page.title: 03Living in Church Hill.
page.content: {Church Hill}has pleasant surroundings. There are lots of trees and play areas and space to ride bikes. Some houses are posh detached houses which people own. Others are semi-detached or terraced, and are rented from the Council. They are nice but have small gardens. It is not far to drive away from all the houses into the countryside. There are five{schools,}a small{shopping centre,}a{health centre with four doctors and a special clinic for new babies. We have two churches. {St. Andrew's}is a new Methodist Centre and is built of brick.{St. Leonard's is as old as the Normans. It is built of stone with stained glass windows and is hidden among the trees at the top of a hill. Every July there is a {fete}at the old church with lots of stalls to buy from and children from local schools give dancing displays.
